title: Southwest Style : A Home-Lover's Guide to Architecture and Design
features: From adobe casitas to log cabins to straw bale homes, this book includes honest, ingenious, and easily adaptable ideas from the heart of the Southwest.
description: Hunter, a writer/stylist who specializes in design, provides a look at contemporary Southwest style, which goes beyond the pastel Native American design previously popular to include a mixture of Spanish, Mexican, and cowboy influences, and shows how to the look has been incorporated into home decor. First an overview is given of the region and the traditional architectural styles and details that comprise the Southwest style. Then homes in Arizona, Colorado, New Mexico, Texas, and Utah are depicted that exemplify each region's style from mountain to desert. Recommended for large interior design collections and where there is an interest. Copyright 2001 Reed Business Information, Inc.

author: {'avatar': 'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41HksIiRhYL._SY600_.jpg', 'name': 'Linda Mason Hunter', 'about': ['Linda Mason Hunter (born in San Juan, Puerto Rico in 1946) lives in Des Moines, Iowa and Vancouver, BC. Formerly employed as a journalist by The Des Moines Register, Meredith Corp., and Rodale Press, she has free-lanced for the past 30 years scouting, producing stories, and supervising photo shoots for major national publications. Recognized nationally for her work in sustainable living and home ecology, she blogs updated green info and home ecology tips at www.lindamasonhunter.com, and hosts "The Green Zone," broadcast daily on KFMG 98.9 FM in Des Moines, streaming at kfmg989.org. Three Green Rats, An Eco Tale is her 13th published book and first work of fiction.
